artist: Polly Apfelbaum; Publisher: Durham Press, Durham, Penn.
creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
medium: Color woodblock monoprint on Japan paper
provenance: Durham Press, Durham, Penn.; (Senior & Shopmaker Gallery, New York, sold to Mersky, 2016); Mary and Bob Mersky, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2016
signed: LRC in pencil: PA 16 |on back in pencil: 3
text: From a series of woodblock monoprints known as Atomic Mystic Portraits, this dazzling geometric abstraction relies on the dynamic interplay of shape, pattern, and brilliant color for its spatial and visual power. Variation and repetition within a structured formal arrangement is key to understanding Apfelbaum’s experimental approach. Working intuitively, she builds complexity from a deliberate, additive process, positioning multiple small woodblocks within a larger rectangular matrix to create a harmonious, visually delightful composition. Each of the woodblocks is inked separately, and then printed simultaneously to form a single composite image.
title: Atomic Mystic Portrait 3
